'Pyridoxal-phosphate' (PLP, pyridoxal-5'-phosphate, P5P) is a prosthetic group
of some enzymes. It is the active form of vitamin B 6,
which comprises three natural organic compounds, pyridoxal, pyridoxamine and
pyridoxine. This cofactor acts as an electron sink in order to stabilize
carbanionic intermediates in both substitution and elimination reactions
involving aminated compounds.
